intro: Schnella vestita, commonly known as the naked schnella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
